column2: VERMONT PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column8: by the pedestrian.
column10: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 2. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 3. When you need to change lanes, it is important to:
column6: signal your intentions ahead of time.
column8: make sure the lane you are about to enter is clear.

column2: 4. This sign means:
column8: Sharp right turn ahead.

column2: 5. To avoid having to make an emergency stop while driving in traffic, drivers should:
column4: look ahead and maintain a safe following distance.
column6: sound their horn to warn other drivers.
column8: drive in the right lane only.
column10: drive slower than the flow of traffic.

column2: 6. Which shape is a yield sign?
column8: Vertical rectangle

column2: 7. This sign indicates:
column8: a side road.

column2: 8. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: pull as far away from the roadside shoulder as possible.
column8: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column8: All traffic must turn right

column2: 10. What should you do if your brakes fail?
column4: Try pumping the brake pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull the steering wheel back.
column10: Hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 11. Distracted driving:
column6: is only dangerous for inexperienced drivers.
column8: usually causes the driver to drive slower.
column10: causes the driver to react more slowly to hazards.

column2: 12. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 13. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: move to another lane if possible.
column6: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column8: activate your stop lights.

column2: 14. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column8: Get out of the car and check behind the car.

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column4: makes drivers more prone to take chances.
column8: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.

column2: 16. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 17. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.
column10: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.

column2: 18. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.
column8: High emphasis warning.

column2: 19. Unlike passenger cars, trucks have blind spots:
column8: reserved for blind people.

column2: 20. To safely cross a railroad, drivers should:
column4: drive across quickly if a train is approaching, or if it is too close, stop and then back up.
column6: stop within 10 feet of all railroad crossings.
column8: look both ways only if the red light is flashing.
column10: listen and look both ways, then proceed if it is safe to do so.
